metadata.title: CVE-2019-6454 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in sd-bus in systemd 239. bus_process_object() inlibsystemd/sd-bus/bus-objects.c allocates a variable-length stack bufferfor temporarily storing the object path of incoming D-Bus messages. Anunprivileged local user can exploit this by sending a specially craftedmessage to PID1, causing the stack pointer to jump over the stack guardpages into an unmapped memory region and trigger a denial of service(systemd PID1 crash and kernel panic).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 237-3ubuntu10.13
libnss-mymachines - 237-3ubuntu10.13
libnss-resolve - 237-3ubuntu10.13
libnss-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.13
libpam-systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.13
libsystemd0 - 237-3ubuntu10.13
libudev1 - 237-3ubuntu10.13
systemd - 237-3ubuntu10.13
systemd-container - 237-3ubuntu10.13
systemd-coredump - 237-3ubuntu10.13
systemd-journal-remote - 237-3ubuntu10.13
systemd-sysv - 237-3ubuntu10.13
systemd-tests - 237-3ubuntu10.13
udev - 237-3ubuntu10.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '237-3ubuntu10.13').
